news_header: An Aboriginal protester was arrested at the Sydney Opera House during the royal visit, highlighting tensions over Indigenous rights and anti-monarchist sentiments.
news_text: On the final day of King Charles and Queen Camilla's tour in Australia, an Aboriginal activist, Wayne Wharton, was arrested at the Sydney Opera House for shouting anti-monarchist slogans and defying police orders. His protest echoed recent heckling by Indigenous Senator Lidia Thorpe, which has sparked mixed reactions among Aboriginal Australians. While some praised Thorpe's bravery, others criticized her actions as disrespectful. As crowds gathered to see the royals, many expressed excitement, with some participants in the protest feeling that their rights and issues were being overlooked. Meanwhile, King Charles engaged with Aboriginal elders and participated in community activities during his visit.
